segments.text: I said Merry Christmas ! Don ’ t you know that Christmas is almost here ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: It is ? Oh , that ’ s nice .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Huh ? Didn ’ t you know ? Aren ’ t you excited ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Actually , I ’ d forgotten about it .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Forgotten about it ? How could you ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Because I ’ m not Christian , I ’ m Jewish .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Oh , I ’ m sorry . I didn ’ t know .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: It ’ s all right . There are so many Christians in America that everybody takes it for granted that I ’ m Christian .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I guess so . So what do you do around this time of year ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Well , I ’ ll celebrate Hanukah soon , but that ’ s not as important to us as Christmas is to you . Mainly I ’ ll just enjoy the holiday break .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Well , would you be horribly offended if I invited you to a Christmas party at my house ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Not at all . A party is a party . I ’ ll be happy to come .
segments.speaker: S2
